42.2. [Remigius of Auxerre] Glosae in Exodum.
Glosses | Exodus
Manuscripts:
1. The Hague, Museum Meermanno-Westreenianum 10.A.7, f. 27ra-33va. saec. xii. *
2. Munich, Bayerische Staatsbibliothek Clm 3704, f. 67r-86v. saec. xi.*
3. Paris, Bibliothèque nationale n.a.l. 762, f. 58v-68v. saec. x. P: Trier, St. Maximin.*
4. Reims, Bibliothèque municipale 451, f. 128r-145r. saec. xii. St. Thierry, Reims *
Attribution to Remigius based on weak circumstantial evidence. Haimo of Auxerre or Israel Scottus could also have written this commentary, or it could just be an anonymous late-Carolingian product, influenced by the school of Auxerre.
